class.name: Phaser.Camera

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: Game reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: id
parameters.help: Not being used at the moment, will be when Phaser supports multiple camera

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: Position of the camera on the X axis

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Position of the camera on the Y axis

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the view rectangle

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the view rectangle

class.help: A Camera is your view into the game world. It has a position and size and renders only those objects within its field of view.\nThe game automatically creates a single Stage sized camera on boot. Move the camera around the world with Phaser.Camera.x/y

public.name: checkWorldBounds
public.help: Method called to ensure the camera doesn't venture outside of the game world.

public.name: focusOn
public.help: Move the camera focus on a display object instantly.

parameters.name: displayObject
parameters.help: The display object to focus the camera on. Must have visible x/y properties.

public.name: focusOnXY
public.help: Move the camera focus on a location instantly.

public.name: follow
public.help: Tells this camera which sprite to follow.

parameters.name: target
parameters.help: The object you want the camera to track. Set to null to not follow anything.

parameters.name: style
parameters.help: Leverage one of the existing "deadzone" presets. If you use a custom deadzone, ignore this parameter and manually specify the deadzone after calling follow().

public.name: reset
public.help: Resets the camera back to 0,0 and un-follows any object it may have been tracking.

public.name: setBoundsToWorld
public.help: Update the Camera bounds to match the game world.

public.name: setPosition
public.help: A helper function to set both the X and Y properties of the camera at once\nwithout having to use game.camera.x and game.camera.y.

public.name: setSize
public.help: Sets the size of the view rectangle given the width and height in parameters.

public.name: unfollow
public.help: Sets the Camera follow target to null, stopping it from following an object if it's doing so.

public.name: _targetPosition
public.inlineHelp: Internal point used to calculate target position

public.name: atLimit
public.inlineHelp: Whether this camera is flush with the World Bounds or not.

public.name: bounds
public.help: The Camera is bound to this Rectangle and cannot move outside of it. By default it is enabled and set to the size of the World.\nThe Rectangle can be located anywhere in the world and updated as often as you like. If you don't wish the Camera to be bound\nat all then set this to null. The values can be anything and are in World coordinates, with 0,0 being the center of the world.
public.inlineHelp: The Rectangle in which the Camera is bounded. Set to null to allow for movement anywhere.

public.name: deadzone
public.inlineHelp: Moving inside this Rectangle will not cause the camera to move.

public.name: displayObject
public.inlineHelp: The display object to which all game objects are added. Set by World.boot

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: height
public.help: The Cameras height. By default this is the same as the Game size and should not be adjusted for now.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the cameras height.

public.name: id
public.inlineHelp: Reserved for future multiple camera set-ups.

public.name: position
public.help: The Cameras position. This value is automatically clamped if it falls outside of the World bounds.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the cameras xy position using Phaser.Point object.

public.name: roundPx
public.inlineHelp: If a Camera has roundPx set to `true` it will call `view.floor` as part of its update loop, keeping its boundary to integer values. Set this to `false` to disable this from happening.

public.name: scale
public.inlineHelp: The scale of the display object to which all game objects are added. Set by World.boot

public.name: screenView
public.inlineHelp: Used by Sprites to work out Camera culling.

public.name: target
public.inlineHelp: If the camera is tracking a Sprite, this is a reference to it, otherwise null.

public.name: view
public.help:
Camera view.
The view into the world we wish to render (by default the game dimensions).
The x/y values are in world coordinates, not screen coordinates, the width/height is how many pixels to render.
Objects outside of this view are not rendered if set to camera cull.

public.name: visible
public.inlineHelp: Whether this camera is visible or not.

public.name: width
public.help: The Cameras width. By default this is the same as the Game size and should not be adjusted for now.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the cameras width.

public.name: world
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the game world.

public.name: x
public.help: The Cameras x coordinate. This value is automatically clamped if it falls outside of the World bounds.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the cameras x position.

public.name: y
public.help: The Cameras y coordinate. This value is automatically clamped if it falls outside of the World bounds.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the cameras y position.

private.name: position
private.inlineHelp: Current position of the camera in world.
